abstract: Macy's and Home Depot report quarterly earnings as they face significant challenge untangling gridlocked shipments in wake of labor dispute at West Coast ports; Macy's reports net income of $793 million, beating analyst expectations; Home Depot reports fourth-quarter net income of $1.38 billion, up 36 percent from year-earlier period, also beating analyst expectations.
lead_paragraph: The department store and home improvement chains, which both reported solid fourth-quarter earnings, have yet to see the full impact of shipping delays that hit inventory levels during a West Coast ports dispute.

headline.main: West Coast Port Gridlock Hits Inventory at Macy’s and Home Depot
headline.print_headline: West Coast Port Gridlock Hits Inventory at Macy’s and Home Depot

snippet: The department store and home improvement chains, which both reported solid fourth-quarter earnings, have yet to see the full impact of shipping delays that hit inventory levels during a West Coast ports dispute.
